Web Server API¶

A flask web server.

web_server.current_county¶

the current selected county chosen by the user. Is shown as h1 header.

Type

str

web_server.counties¶

name and corresponding parameter (which is passed to plotter methods) of all counties plus all_counties.

Type

dict

web_server.app¶

the flask server.

Type

Flask

web_server.handle_selection()¶

Handles dropdown selection by updating the chart to chosen value on dropdown.

Returns

calls root which starts re-rendering process of html.

web_server.plot_visualization()¶

Renders plot_chart.html. It sets header of html to be county name, and fills dropdown menu with counties.

Returns

render_template(‘plot_chart.html’, counties=counties, county=current_county)

web_server.plot_visualization_json()¶

This function gets called by plot_chart.html template. It creates a layered chart, then reads and returns it as json.

Returns

layered chart as json

web_server.plot_visualization_json_1()¶

This function gets called by plot_chart.html template. It creates a new cases chart, then reads and returns it as json.

Returns

new cases chart as json

web_server.plot_visualization_json_2()¶

This function gets called by plot_chart.html template. It creates a Cumulative number chart, then reads and returns it as json.

Returns

Cumulative number chart as json

web_server.root()¶

This is our root function which doesn’t do anything other than calling than plot_visualization to render html.

Returns

plot_visualization()
